minCount: 1.message: You may be missing SSDTs. **[Click here for more information](https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Install-Guide/config-laptop.plist/broadwell.html#starting-point)**

Path: ^(?!((SSDT-OLA(.*)|MALD(.*)).aml)).message: Sanity Checker detected that your config most likely comes from OLARILA. Instead we recommend following **[Dortania's OC Install Guide](https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Install-Guide/)** to install VANILLA macOS on your machine, however that doesn't mean you can't use our service :)

Enabled: true.message: **{0}** ACPI is disabled. Please check if you need this ACPI and enable it if it's necessary

**{0}** patch is disabled.
Note: If you are using `SSDT-XOSI`, enable `Change _OSI to XOSI` patch

DevirtualiseMmio: false.message: **{0}** should be disabled if your MOBO doesn't require it

EnableSafeModeSlide: true.message: If OpenCore log says that you need to enable **{0}**, you probably should do it

ProvideCustomSlide: true.message: If OpenCore log says that you need to enable **{0}**, you probably should do it

ResizeAppleGpuBars: -1.message: If your GPU supports *Resizable Bar*, you probably will want to set **{0}** to **0**

minCount: 1.message: You may be missing Kexts. **[Click here for more information](https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Install-Guide/ktext.html#kexts)**

BundlePath: Lilu.kext.message: **{0}** isn't here. Please download it, place it in `OC/Kexts` and run `OC Snapshot` with **[ProperTree](https://github.com/corpnewt/ProperTree)** to add it properly into to your config

BundlePath: VirtualSMC.kext.message: **{0}** isn't here. Please download it, place it in `OC/Kexts` and run `OC Snapshot` with **[ProperTree](https://github.com/corpnewt/ProperTree)** to add it properly into to your config

BundlePath: SMCProcessor.kext.message: **{0}** (VirtualSMC plugin) isn't here. It's **not necessary** because it's for monitoring Intel CPU temps however if you want to include it - download it, place it in `OC/Kexts` and run `OC Snapshot` with **[ProperTree](https://github.com/corpnewt/ProperTree)** to add it properly into to your config

BundlePath: SMCSuperIO.kext.message: **{0}** (VirtualSMC plugin) isn't here. It's **not necessary** because it's for monitoring fan speeds, however if you want to include it - download it, place it in `OC/Kexts` and run `OC Snapshot` with **[ProperTree](https://github.com/corpnewt/ProperTree)** to add it properly into to your config

BundlePath: WhateverGreen.kext.message: **{0}** isn't here. Please download it, place it in `OC/Kexts` and run `OC Snapshot` with **[ProperTree](https://github.com/corpnewt/ProperTree)** to add it properly into to your config

Enabled: true.message: **{0}** is disabled. Please follow **[Dortania's Gathering Files](https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Install-Guide/ktext.html)** subpage to check if this kext is needed for your hardware and enable it

AppleCpuPmCfgLock: false.message: **{0}** should be enabled if running 10.10 or older and you have CFG-Lock enabled

AppleXcpmCfgLock: false.message: **{0}** should be enabled if you have CFG-Lock enabled

CustomSMBIOSGuid: false.message: If you have DELL or VIAO system, you probably will want to enable **{0}** quirk

DisableIoMapper: false.message: **{0}** should be enabled if VT-D is enabled in BIOS

LapicKernelPanic: false.message: If you have HP system, you probably will want to enable **{0}** quirk

PanicNoKextDump: true.message: It is recommended to have **{0}** enabled, if you don't know what this quirk does, you should have it enabled

PowerTimeoutKernelPanic: true.message: It is recommended to have **{0}** enabled, so macOS will not kernel panic on setPowerState timeout

XhciPortLimit: false.message:
**{0}** must be disabled for macOS 11.3+.
Note: To map USB ports on `Windows` you can use **[USBToolBox](https://github.com/USBToolBox/tool)**. Unfortunately, there is no `Linux` tool that allows to do it

AppleDebug: true.message: **{0}** should be enabled if you want to have more debugging information

ApplePanic: true.message: **{0}** should be enabled if you want to log kernel panics to disk

DisableWatchDog: true.message: **{0}** should be enabled for debugging early boot issues

Target: 67.message: **{0}** should be set to **{1}** if you want to have more debugging information

AllowSetDefault: true.message: If you want to allow setting default boot option in OpenCore picker, you should enable **{0}**

BlacklistAppleUpdate: true.message: **{0}** should be enabled to OpenCore ignore boot options trying to update Apple peripheral firmware

ScanPolicy: 0.message: For installation process, please set **{0}** to **{1}**. Bare in mind that this isn't considered secure value and such, you should learn more **[here](https://dortania.github.io/OpenCore-Post-Install/universal/security/scanpolicy.html)** to learn what value is secure

SecureBootModel: Default.message: **{0}** should be **Disabled** if you want to use Nvidia Web Drivers or selected SMBIOS doesn't support Apple Secure Boot (not to be confused with Secure Boot in your BIOS)

Vault: Optional.message: **{0}** should be **Enabled** if you want to enable OpenCore vaulting mechanism

MLB: ^(?!(M0000000000000001)).message: Board serial is missing. Please generate it corresponding to model specified in config by using **[GenSMBIOS](https://github.com/corpnewt/GenSMBIOS)**

ROM: ^(?!(112233000000|112233445566)).message: MAC address is missing. You probably will want it to be your NIC MAC address

SystemSerialNumber: ^(?!(W00000000001)).message: Serial number is missing. Please generate it corresponding to model specified in config by using **[GenSMBIOS](https://github.com/corpnewt/GenSMBIOS)**

SystemUUID: ^(?!(00000000-0000-0000-0000.message: UUID is missing. Please generate it corresponding to model specified in config by using **[GenSMBIOS](https://github.com/corpnewt/GenSMBIOS)**
